alert.note: Alert for Atchison; Doniphan; Leavenworth (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 5:24PM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Leavenworth, eastern Atchison, southeastern Doniphan, Buchanan, southern Carroll, northeastern Jackson, Clinton, Clay, Ray, southern Caldwell, northwestern Saline, Lafayette and Platte Counties through 600 PM CST... At 523 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oskaloosa to near Kansas City to near Oak Grove. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, St. Joseph, Leavenworth, Liberty, Gladstone, Excelsior Springs, Atchison, Smithville, Kearney, Richmond, Odessa, Higginsville, Lexington, Platte City, Carrollton, Buckner, Lawson, Plattsburg and Lathrop. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 35 and 56. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 14 and 48. Interstate 29 between mile markers 8 and 45. Interstate 435 between mile markers 25 and 51. Interstate 229 between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
